author: timbeiko
content:
**ACDE 189 Recap**
- After a lot of back and forth, we finalized the Pectra scope ðŸŽ‰ ! EOF and EIP-7702 are both included (PR: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8627). To give teams time to work on their EOF implementations and do cross-client testing on everything else in the fork, devnet-1 will **not** include EOF, but will include all other Pectra EIPs. Notably, we'll include 7702 even though the spec may still be changed. 
- We're tentatively planning to include the following changes in devnet-1, but will leave a few more days for people to review them prior to merging the PRs: 
    - https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8625
    - https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/554
    - https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/549
    - https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/545 (already merged)
- We discussed deactivating EIP-158, as it would cause issues similar to SELFDESTRUCT in a post-Verkle world and EIP-7702 as currently specified could create accounts with 0 nonce/balance/codehash but storage. <@353136597522448385> will draft a proposal to formally consider the change. If 7702 is tweaked in a way that does not cause this issue, we'd consider it for the Verkle fork. 
- <@364458974906548225> came on to get a status update on EIP-4444 & portal support by client teams. A few client teams have begun working on this, but flagged that they currently have many competing priorities. The Portal team will keep monitoring <#953349957400821860> to offer help to any client team needing it!
- We briefly discussed my proposed ACD/Network Upgrade Process/EthMag change doc (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/allcoredevs-network-upgrade-ethmagicians-process-improvements/20157) and agreed to try the "EIP Review Request" proposal. There weren't any objections to PFI/CFI/SFI, but given the scope I'll open a PR for us to discuss before agreeing to the change. 
- Testing teams proposed a new channel layout for discord (see above)

author: timbeiko
content:
And, lastly, we flagged the upcoming EPBS (tomorrow) and PeerDAS (June 11) breakouts:
- https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1060
- https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1059
